loretype-enchantment: Enchanting recipe manual. Teaches you how to identify the properties of an enchantment.
craftinginfo-enchanting-text:
Enchanting

To begin enchanting, you will need an Enchanting Table.
Once you have your Enchanting Table, you will need to place a number of reagents and a target item for the enchantment. By default, a valid reagent would by a number of gemstones, like emerald, peridot, or diamond.

Only certain items may be enchanted. Typically, low quality or stone tools cannot hold an enchantment. By default, the strength of the enchantment is random, based off the Potential value of the reagent. Most enchantments take 1 in-game hour to enchant, but can vary.

You can find details on enchantments on the Wiki.
cmd-reload-help: Reload all KRPG mod configs. Server restart may be required to see changes.
cmd-version-help: Check version of all KRPG mods.
cmd-e-add-help:
Add an enchantment to the item held in your main hand. 
Ex: krpg e add frost 5
cmd-e-add-success: Successfully added enchantment to the held item.
cmd-e-add-fail:
Failed to add enchant to the held item. 
Ex: krpg e add frost 5
cmd-e-list-fail: Could not find any registered enchantments.
cmd-e-set-help:
Overwrites all enchantments on the item held in your main hand to the given enchantment string. 
Ex: krpg e set frost:1;pit:2;harming:5
cmd-e-remove-success: Successfully removed enchantment from the held item.
cmd-e-remove-fail:
Failed to remove enchantment from the held item. 
Ex: krpg e remove frost
cmd-e-remove-help:
Remove an enchantment from the item held in your main hand. 
Ex: krpg e remove frost
cmd-e-removeall-success: Successfully removed all enchantments from the held item.
cmd-e-removeall-fail:
Failed to remove all enchantments from the held item. 
Ex: krpg e removeall
cmd-e-removeall-help:
Remove an enchantment from the item held in your main hand. 
Ex: krpg e removeall
cmd-reload-config-help: Reloads the config from file. Server restart may be required to see changes.
cmd-reloadcfg-success: Config reloaded. Server restart may be required to see changes.
MaxEnchantTierComment: Sets the maximum tier a reagent can imbue into an item when enchanting.
EnchantTimeHoursComment: Sets the amount of time to perform an enchantment in in-game hours. -1 disables the override.
LatentEnchantResetDaysComment: Sets the amount of days between Latent Enchantment resets. 0 resets every time the item is checked by an Enchanting Table.
MaxLatentEnchantsComment: Sets the amount of Latent Enchantments an item can hold at a single time. 0 effectively disables players enchanting items on their own.
MaxEnchantsByCategoryComment: Defines how many of each Category of Enchantment can be imbued into a single item. -1 disables limits.
MaxDamageEnchantsComment: Sets the amount of Damage Enchantments an item can hold at a single time. This includes Flaming, Frost, Harming, and Shocking. -1 or less is no limit.
LegacyReagentPotentialComment: Disables the new Reagent Power system, in favor of the pre-1.0.0 'Potential' values when determining the max level enchantment a reagent can be used for.
ChargeReagentHoursComment: Sets the amount of time to perform a reagent charge in hours.
MaxReagentChargeComment: Sets the maximum charge that a reagent can be charged to.
ChargePerGearComment: Sets the amount of charge a single gear will provide to a reagent in the charging table.
ValidReagentsComment: Item and quantity required to perform an Enchantment.
